title: fix(learn): update text as code for vector-dot-product.md
body:
Checklist:

<!-- Please follow this checklist and put an x in each of the boxes, like this: [x]. It will ensure that our team takes your pull request seriously. -->

- [X] I have read [freeCodeCamp's contribution guidelines](https://contribute.freecodecamp.org).
- [X] My pull request has a descriptive title (not a vague title like `Update index.md`)
- [X] My pull request targets the `master` branch of freeCodeCamp.
- [X] All the files I changed are in the same world language, for example: only English changes, or only Chinese changes, etc.

<!--If your pull request closes a GitHub issue, replace the XXXXX below with the issue number.-->

Closes #40036 
<!-- Feel free to add any additional description of changes below this line -->

1) Make changes to the text of the challenge.
2) Update one of the test case.

I have tested this in local.

title: Cypress test development mode

labels.name: scope: tools/scripts
labels.description: Scripts for supporting dev work, generating config and build artifacts, etc.

labels.name: type: feature request
labels.description: Threads classified to be feature requests. Implementation to be considered as a nice to have

body:
By only testing the built site https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/blob/b0e3d7369b669b7c91caf3dfc644fb2da5df0cbe/.github/workflows/cypress.yml#L58-L65

we miss errors, because Gatsby suppresses them in production.  For example bumping react-redux, https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/pull/39941, passed all our tests, but introduced a bug with the hotkeys.

I think we should do at least one of

- Run the Cypress tests on the development site
- Add tests for the hotkeys that broke

title: Incorrect result processing Euler-81

labels.name: scope: learn
labels.description: Lessons, Challenges, Projects and other Curricular Content in curriculum directory.

labels.name: status: discussing
labels.description: Under discussion threads. Closed as stale after 60 days of inactivity.

body:
During Euler 81st challange I found that exactly the needed result in testMatrix is checked as wrong:
![Euler-81-error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10043733/97969270-de01e000-1dd0-11eb-8031-bf0c06571b77.png)
reference code for challane is here: https://github.com/VadimEv/ProjectEuler100/blob/master/Euler-81.js
In console I added explicit output to highlight the value given in test run.

title: Data Structures: Implement Heap Sort with a Min Heap (Passing)

labels.name: scope: learn
labels.description: Lessons, Challenges, Projects and other Curricular Content in curriculum directory.

labels.name: status: needs help for triage
labels.description: To be applied to issues if they need investigation prior a fix.

body:
Hey there,

Here is what the challenge description says regarding the sort method.
"The sort method should return an array of all the elements in the min heap sorted from smallest to largest."

I am literally returning an empty array and the challenge keeps on passing.

[Data Structures: Implement Heap Sort with a Min Heap](https://www.freecodecamp.org/learn/coding-interview-prep/data-structures/implement-heap-sort-with-a-min-heap)

* Browser Name: Chrome
* Browser Version: Version 86.0.4240.111 (Official Build) (64-bit)
* Operating System: Windows 10 Home

![ezgif com-gif-maker](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26346408/97917921-0fe65880-1d77-11eb-9286-a9d5b6a91cf7.gif)

title: feat(api): allow redirects in development

labels.name: platform: api
labels.description: Server application that needs familiarity with Express, Loopback, MongoDB etc.

title: Bring @freecodecamp/eslint-config inside the monorepo

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Open for all. You do not need permission to work on these.

body:
We currently have some eslint configuration in the published package and some inside freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp - this is a bit confusing.  Is there a good reason to maintain the eslint-config repo separately?

If not, I think we should manage it with Lerna instead.

title: PostCSS

labels.name: platform: client
labels.description: UI side of the client application that needs familiarity with React, Gatsby etc.

labels.name: type: feature request
labels.description: Threads classified to be feature requests. Implementation to be considered as a nice to have

body:
We use `gatsby-plugin-postcss`, but I think we could do more with it.  

For example, we already use `import 'style.css';` syntax, but we don't (as far as I can see) use CSS Modules to scope those files.  If we do start using this we will have to validate the style changes, but I think the increased modularity should make it easier to maintain.

cc: @ahmadabdolsaheb

title: chore(deps): bump nanoid from 1.3.4 to 3.1.16 in /api-server

labels.name: dependabot
labels.description: Package update created by Dependabot

labels.name: platform: api
labels.description: Server application that needs familiarity with Express, Loopback, MongoDB etc.

body:
Bumps [nanoid](https://github.com/ai/nanoid) from 1.3.4 to 3.1.16.
Release notes

Sourced from nanoid's releases.

3.0 Migration Guide

Nano ID 3.0 is the biggest release in the project history. Unfortunately, you will need to change the code of your application. But the changes are very small in most cases. In return, you will have better performance, smaller size, ES modules and TypeScript support.

Known Issues

  • Only Create React App 4.0 supports dual ESM/CJS modules.

Simple Case

In simple cases, you just need to change default import to named import.

- import nanoid from 'nanoid'
+ import { nanoid } from 'nanoid'

nanoid() //=> "sSAi9F8yakJZPxOCr_WFb"
nanoid(5) //=> "ISe9l"

If you support IE, you need to transpile node_modules by Babel.

Non-secure and asynchronous Nano ID need only import changes as well.

- import nanoid from 'nanoid/non-secure'
+ import { nanoid } from 'nanoid/non-secure'

nanoid() //=> "sSAi9F8yakJZPxOCr_WFb"


- import nanoid from 'nanoid/async'
+ import { nanoid } from 'nanoid/async'

nanoid().then(id => {
  id //=> "sSAi9F8yakJZPxOCr_WFb"
})

TypeScript

Remove @types/nanoid if you have it. Nano ID now have built-in types.

npm uninstall @types/nanoid

React Native

For Expo you need to load the file by direct path:

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from nanoid's changelog.

3.1.16

  • Speeded up Nano ID 4 times (by Peter Boyer).

3.1.15

  • Fixed package.types path.

3.1.14

  • Added package.types.

3.1.13

  • Removed Node.js 15.0.0 with randomFillSync regression from engines.node.

3.1.12

  • Improved IE 11 docs.

3.1.11

  • Fixed asynchronous customAlphabet in browser (by @LoneRifle).

3.1.10

  • Fix ES modules support.

3.1.9

  • Try to fix React Native Expo support.

3.1.8

  • Add React Native Expo support.

3.1.7

  • Clean up code.

3.1.6

  • Avoid self using.

3.1.5

  • Improve IE docs and warning.

3.1.4

  • Restrict old Node.js 13 by engines.node (by Cansin Yildiz).

3.1.3

  • Fix ES modules issue with CLI.

3.1.2

  • Add shebang to CLI.

3.1.1

  • Fix CLI.

3.1

  • Add npx nanoid CLI.

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 1946237 Release 3.1.16 version
  • d9b5f01 Fix benchmark CLI name
  • 2fde88c Update benchmark
  • 5933dbe Clean up code
  • 5b765f1 Generate random numbers in larger request sizes (#243)
  • 126d89c Update uuid benchmark
  • 81dd8d1 Update dependencies
  • f1c49ce Example has 22 not 21 chars (#242)
  • dc5faec Release 3.1.15 version
  • 921aeef Fix package.types
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=nanoid&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=1.3.4&new-version=3.1.16)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/configuring-github-dependabot-security-updates) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---

title: chore(deps): bump stripe from 6.36.0 to 8.119.0 in /api-server

labels.name: dependabot
labels.description: Package update created by Dependabot

labels.name: platform: api
labels.description: Server application that needs familiarity with Express, Loopback, MongoDB etc.

body:
Bumps [stripe](https://github.com/stripe/stripe-node) from 6.36.0 to 8.119.0.
Release notes

Sourced from stripe's releases.

v8.119.0

  • #1056 Add payment_method_details[interac_present][preferred_locales] on Charge
  • #1057 Standardize on CRULD order for method definitions
  • #1055 Added requirements to README

See the changelog for more details.

v8.118.0

  • #1053 Multiple API changes
    • Improving Typescript types for nullable parameters and introduced Stripe.Emptyable as a type
    • Add support for payment_method_options[card][cvc_token] on PaymentIntent
    • Add support for cvc_update[cvc] on Token creation
  • #1052 Add Stripe.Emptyable type definition

See the changelog for more details.

v8.117.0

  • #1050 Add support for passing p24[bank] for P24 on PaymentIntent or PaymentMethod

See the changelog for more details.

v8.116.0

  • #1049 Support passing tax_rates when creating invoice items through Subscription or SubscriptionSchedule

See the changelog for more details.

v8.115.0

  • #1048 Add support for jp_rn and ru_kpp as a type on TaxId
  • #1046 chore: replace recommended extension sublime babel with babel javascript

See the changelog for more details.

v8.114.0

  • #1045 Make original_payout and reversed_by not optional anymore

See the changelog for more details.

v8.113.0

  • #1044 Add support for discounts on Session.create

See the changelog for more details.

v8.112.0

  • #1042 Add support for the Payout Reverse API
  • #1041 Do not mutate user-supplied opts

See the changelog for more details.

v8.111.0

  • #1038 Add support for description, iin and issuer in payment_method_details[card_present] and payment_method_details[interac_present] on Charge

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from stripe's changelog.

8.119.0 - 2020-10-27

  • #1056 Add payment_method_details[interac_present][preferred_locales] on Charge
  • #1057 Standardize on CRULD order for method definitions
  • #1055 Added requirements to README

8.118.0 - 2020-10-26

  • #1053 Multiple API changes
    • Improving Typescript types for nullable parameters and introduced Stripe.Emptyable as a type
    • Add support for payment_method_options[card][cvc_token] on PaymentIntent
    • Add support for cvc_update[cvc] on Token creation
  • #1052 Add Stripe.Emptyable type definition

8.117.0 - 2020-10-23

  • #1050 Add support for passing p24[bank] for P24 on PaymentIntent or PaymentMethod

8.116.0 - 2020-10-22

  • #1049 Support passing tax_rates when creating invoice items through Subscription or SubscriptionSchedule

8.115.0 - 2020-10-20

  • #1048 Add support for jp_rn and ru_kpp as a type on TaxId
  • #1046 chore: replace recommended extension sublime babel with babel javascript

8.114.0 - 2020-10-15

  • #1045 Make original_payout and reversed_by not optional anymore

8.113.0 - 2020-10-14

  • #1044 Add support for discounts on Session.create

8.112.0 - 2020-10-14

  • #1042 Add support for the Payout Reverse API
  • #1041 Do not mutate user-supplied opts

8.111.0 - 2020-10-12

  • #1038 Add support for description, iin and issuer in payment_method_details[card_present] and payment_method_details[interac_present] on Charge

8.110.0 - 2020-10-12

  • #1035 Add support for setup_intent.requires_action on Event

8.109.0 - 2020-10-09

  • #1033 Add support for internal-only description, iin, and issuer for card_present and interac_present on Charge.payment_method_details

8.108.0 - 2020-10-08

  • #1028 Add support for Bancontact/iDEAL/Sofort -> SEPA
    • Add support for generated_sepa_debit and generated_sepa_debit_mandate on Charge.payment_method_details.ideal, Charge.payment_method_details.bancontact and Charge.payment_method_details.sofort
    • Add support for generated_from on PaymentMethod.sepa_debit
    • Add support for ideal, bancontact and sofort on SetupAttempt.payment_method_details

8.107.0 - 2020-10-02

  • #1026 Add support for tos_acceptance[service_agreement] on Account
  • #1025 Add support for new payments capabilities on Account

... (truncated)

  • 4f1b82f Codegen for openapi e215279
  • f8b3194 Add Stripe.Emptyable type definition (#1052)

Release notes

Sourced from normalizr's releases.

v3.6.1

No release notes provided.

v3.6.0

  • Added fallbackStrategy for denormalization (#422)
  • Fixed entities can be undefined in TS defs if none found (#435)

v3.5.0

  • Added ability to dynamically set nested schema type (#415)
  • Changed Enable loose transformation for object spread operator to improve performance (#431)
  • Fixed don't use schema to attribute mapping on singular array schemas (#387)
  • Fixed When normalize() receives null input, don't say it is an object (#411)
  • Fixed Improve performance of circular reference detection (#420)

v3.4.0

  • Changed Now built with Babel 7
  • Added Support for circular references (gh-335)
  • Added Symbols are valid keys for Entity keys (gh-369)
  • Added/Changed Typescript definitions include generics for normalize (gh-363)
  • Fixed denormalization skipping of falsy valued ids used in Object schemas (gh-345)
  • Chore Update dev dependencies
  • Chore Added Greenkeeper

v3.3.0

  • Added ES Module builds
  • Fixed type error with typescript on array+object shorthand (gh-322)

v3.2.0

  • Added Support denormoalizing from Immutable entities (gh-228)
  • Added Brought back get idAttribute() to schema.Entity (gh-226)
  • Fixed Gracefully handle missing data in denormalize (gh-232)
  • Fixed Prevent infinite recursion in denormalize (gh-220)

v3.1.0 - denormalize

  • Added denormalize. (gh-214)
  • Changed No longer requires all input in a polymorphic schema (Array, Union, Values) have a matching schema definition. (gh-208)
  • Changed Builds do both rollup and plain babel file conversions. "main" property in package.json points to babel-converted files.

v3.0.1

  • Fixes critical bug in some browsers with schema.Array. (#203)

v3.0.0

The entire normalizr package has been rewritten from v2.x for this version. Please refer to the documentation for all changes.

Added

  • schema.Entity
    • processStrategy for modifying Entity objects before they're moved to the entities stack.
    • mergeStrategy for merging with multiple entities with the same ID.
  • Added schema.Object, with a shorthand of {}
  • Added schema.Array, with a shorthand of [ schema ]

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from normalizr's changelog.

  • Chore Upgraded development dependencies

title: Local Dev Tool to Change developmentuser's Settings

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Open for all. You do not need permission to work on these.

labels.name: scope: tools/scripts
labels.description: Scripts for supporting dev work, generating config and build artifacts, etc.

labels.name: status: discussing
labels.description: Under discussion threads. Closed as stale after 60 days of inactivity.

labels.name: type: feature request
labels.description: Threads classified to be feature requests. Implementation to be considered as a nice to have

body:
Spending too much time working on the client side, it is becoming tedious to test features which require the developmentuser to have certain certificates/settings. The main one being time taken to claim the certs.

Is there scope to include a dev tool to complete certain operations with ease? What would this look like?
- A new npm script to `npm run dev:claim-all-certs`
- A simple interface to allow devs to input specific URLs/Solutions

Main time-taking tasks:
- Trying to claim backend certs which have tests (I need to scavenge through my Repl and Glitch account to get a project which still hopefully passes.
- Trying to claim JS cert which requires solutions (I normally copy-pasta the `.md` solution, but still is tedious)

It is not as simple as just changing the devuser to be `isJsCertified`, because then it misses the solutions.

title: Running Python in the browser for python courses @ FreeCodeCamp

labels.name: type: feature request
labels.description: Threads classified to be feature requests. Implementation to be considered as a nice to have

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. I'm always frustrated when [...]

I have enjoyed learning front-end development through freecodecamp and it's smooth experience. Everything was in a single browser window: code, exercise instruction, web page and console.

Wouldn't it be nice, if we could have the same for python course as well by running python into the browser ?

**Describe the solution you'd like**
A clear and concise description of what you want to happen.
This [webpage](https://anvil.works/blog/python-in-the-browser-talk) talks about multiple solution that facilitates running python in the browser. 

Author makes a case for using skulpt for running  basic python and pyodide for data-science python workload. 

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.

Another alternative would be to run python code on server using containers e.g. [mybinder.org](mybinder.org). I believe [datacamp.com](datacamp.com) uses that. but this will increase the server cost. 

**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

https://skulpt.org/
https://pyodide-cdn2.iodide.io/v0.15.0/full/console.html

v4.0.0

CHANGELOG

Changelog

Sourced from webpack-cli's changelog.

4.0.0 (2020-10-10)

Bug Fixes

  • add compilation lifecycle in watch instance (#1903) (02b6d21)
  • cleanup package-utils package (#1822) (fd5b92b)

Features

4.0.0-rc.1 (2020-10-06)

Bug Fixes

  • cache issue (#1862) (305c188)

  • mode behaviour (#1824) (9e9c70b)
  • only set output path on passing flag (#1855) (2f36b9d)
  • show warning if bail and watch are used together (#1804) (6140b24)
  • warning should not result in non-zero exit code (#1872) (ae9539d)

Features

  • add --analyze flag (#1853) (e6d210a)
  • allow users to store stats as json to a file (#1835) (3907517)

4.0.0-beta.9 (2020-09-19)

New Features

  • allow using cjs as default config (#1775)

title: Quote Machine Tweet button doesn't work on CodePen due to Twitter's API

labels.name: scope: learn
labels.description: Lessons, Challenges, Projects and other Curricular Content in curriculum directory.

labels.name: status: needs help for triage
labels.description: To be applied to issues if they need investigation prior a fix.

body: **Describe your problem and how to reproduce it:** The Tweet button on the Quote Machine project isn't working due to twitter.com refusing to connect and a ERR_BLOCKED_BY_RESPONSE error. User story 10 in the instructions for this project states > I can tweet the current quote by clicking on the `#tweet-quote` `a` element. This `a` element should include the `"twitter.com/intent/tweet"` path in its `href` attribute to tweet the current quote. So I did some digging in Twitter’s web intents documentation and found that **web intents cannot be loaded inside an iframe** (about halfway through Working with Web Intents section). I looked into how CodePen renders its projects, and in both the editor and full views, it renders as an iframe. Since the user has no control over Twitter’s rules, or how CodePen renders the project, I don’t know how a tweet button could be successfully implemented in this project. Maybe posting to another social media site could be implemented instead? **Add a Link to the page with the problem:** - [FreeCodeCamp quote machine instructions](https://www.freecodecamp.org/learn/front-end-libraries/front-end-libraries-projects/build-a-random-quote-machine) - [FreeCodeCamp official example](https://codepen.io/freeCodeCamp/full/qRZeGZ) - [Twitter documentation for web intents](https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/twitter-for-websites/web-intents/overview) **Tell us about your browser and operating system:** * Browser Name: Google Chrome * Browser Version: 86.0.4240.111 * Operating System: MacOS Catalina (10.15.6) **If possible, add a screenshot here (you can drag and drop, png, jpg, gif, etc. in this box):**
